Authors:
Xian dong Yu, Shengnan Zhang, Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon,
Jian-Kui Liu
Title:
Additions to Occulibambusaceae (Pleosporales,
Dothideomycetes)
Keywords:
3 new taxa, multi-gene, phylogeny, sexual morph,
taxonomy
Abstract:
During a survey of microfungi associated with palms from
karst formations, three novel asco-mycetes were found from decaying
petioles of Trachycarpus fortunei (Arecaceae) in Guizhou, China.
Multi-gene phylogenetic analyses based on a combined SSU, ITS, LSU, RPB2
and TEF1Î± sequence data showed that these collections were affiliated to
Brunneofusispora and Neooccultibambusa in the family Occultibambusaceae.
A new species Brunneofusispora inclinatiostiola is introduced. It is
phy-logenetically close to B. clematidis but represents a distinct
lineage. Morphologically, it differs from the latter in having immersed
ascomata with eccentric, periphysate ostiole and smaller ascospores. Two
isolates of Neooccultibambusa kaiyangensis sp. nov. clustered with the
generic type N. chiangraiensis, but can be distinguished by the
morphology (ascospores dimension) and phylogeny evidences. Whereas,
Neooccultibambusa trachycarpi sp. nov. can be recognized as a
phylogenetically distinct species. A detailed, illustrated description
is provided for these three novel species, and the phylogenetic
relationship of Neooccultibambusa is discussed.
